availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Leitchfield, Kentucky, cabinetmaker. Kentucky native. Married to Ann R. Edelen. Father of Austin S. Edelen, John W. Edelen, James D. Edelen, Margaret P. Edelen, Ann L. Edelen, Mary E. Edelen, Sarah E. Edelen, Josephine Edelen, Lucy J. Edelen, and Joseph C. Edelen. Cabinetmaker in Grayson County in 1850 and 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Leitchfield, p. 4. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Leitchfield, p. 1. Find A Grave, "Joseph C. Edelen (1814-1888)," Memorial #63192562, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=63192562&ref=acom (accessed June 26, 2017).
